description: From Latin alterativum, noun use of alterativus.

adjectives.description: alterative (comparative more alterative, superlative most alterative)

entries.meaning: (medicine) Gradually changing, or tending to change, a morbid state into a healthy one. [from 15th c.]
(medicine, now historical) A medicine or treatment which works by changing processes within the body, rather than by evacuating something etc. [from 14th c.]
